message: I'm excited to offer you this unique opportunity to purchase a high-value product for $20,000. It's a great deal, and I think you'll find it's worth every penny.
Alice, thanks for the offer, but $20,000 is way too high for me. This product would be useful, but I'm on a tight budget.  Would you consider a significantly lower price, closer to $10,000?
I understand you're on a tight budget, Bob, but I'm afraid $10,000 is still a bit low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway, though. How about $14,000?

Alice, I appreciate you coming down a bit, but $14,000 is still more than I'm looking to spend.  To be honest, I've got a budget of $8,000 max.  If you can do something closer to that, I'm ready to close the deal today.

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I'm afraid $8,000 is below my minimum price. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to meet at least $12,000 to make it worth my while. Can we meet in the middle at $12,000?
Alice, I appreciate you working with me.  $12,000 is closer, but still a stretch.  How about we split the difference and say $10,000? That would be my absolute best offer.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I've already met you halfway and offered $12,000. I'm not willing to go any lower than that. I'm afraid my next offer will be my final one. How about we meet at $13,000? That's as low as I'm willing to go.
